dt: {bc}a bed or receptacle prepared by an animal and especially a bird for its eggs and young
{bc}a place or specially modified structure serving as an abode of animals and especially of their immature stages

dt: {bc}the occupants or frequenters of a nest
{bc}a group of objects made to fit close together or one within another

shortdef: a bed or receptacle prepared by an animal and especially a bird for its eggs and young
a place or specially modified structure serving as an abode of animals and especially of their immature stages
a receptacle resembling a bird's nest

dt: {bc}a partly enclosed platform high on a ship's mast for use as a lookout

dt: {bc}to furnish (something, such as an arrow) with a feather
{bc}to cover, clothe, or adorn with or as if with {a_link|feathers}

{bc}to change the angle of (airplane propeller blades) so that the chords become approximately parallel to the line of flight

{bc}to change the angle of (a rotor blade of a rotorcraft) periodically in forward flight
{bc}to reduce the edge of to a {a_link|featheredge}
{bc}to join by a tongue and groove
{bc}to hit, throw, pass, or shoot softly and usually with precision

dt: {bc}to have or take on the appearance of a feather or something {a_link|feathered}
used of ink or a printed impression
{bc}to feather an oar or an airplane propeller blade
{bc}to provide for oneself especially financially by unethically exploiting a position of trust

to cover, clothe, or adorn with or as if with feathers
to turn (an oar blade) almost horizontal when lifting from the water at the end of a stroke to reduce air resistance

dt.t: must have known that his frank comments … would stir up a {it}hornet's nest{/it}
